intro: Astragalus jordanensis, commonly known as Jordan milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the Middle East, particularly Jordan. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to access water from deeper soil layers. Astragalus jordanensis plays a role in stabilizing soils and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
